subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Blogging in Quikscript
msgSnippet: ... Naught is indeed in THOUGHT, as are most words with au .  In general, LOT words are either spelled with o in T.O., or else begin with wa , wha , or
messageBody:
Nathan Sharfi scripsit:

> Any and all typo notices will be greatly appreciated; I'm trying to
> get a better feel for Read's RP, and I'm still adrift when it comes
> to differentiating between the THOUGHT and LOT lexical sets. My
> recollection of "Kevin Phillips Bong (Slightly Silly)…naught"
> suggests that "naught" and "thought" are in the same lexical set,
> but I wouldn't bet money on it.

"Naught" is indeed in THOUGHT, as are most words with "au". In general,
LOT words are either spelled with "o" in T.O., or else begin with "wa",
"wha", or "qua", i.e. /wQ/.

--
Her he asked if O'Hare Doctor tidings sent from far John Cowan
coast and she with grameful sigh him answered that http://ccil.org/~cowan
O'Hare Doctor in heaven was. Sad was the man that word cowan@...
to hear that him so heavied in bowels ruthful. All
she there told him, ruing death for friend so young, James Joyce, Ulysses
algate sore unwilling God's rightwiseness to withsay. "Oxen of the Sun"
